title: Unchanging
data:
**Unchanging** is a [property](/wiki/Property "Property") in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* that prevents the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") from being [polymorphed](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") or otherwise transformed into another [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") or form.

The only source of the property is the [worn](/wiki/Worn "Worn") [amulet of unchanging](/wiki/Amulet_of_unchanging "Amulet of unchanging").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 Messages](#Messages)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.2 FIQHack](#FIQHack)
  - [4.3 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [4.4 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [4.5 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [5 References](#References)

## Description

Unchanging stops polymorphing and other means of changing form from occurring, including [sliming](/wiki/Sliming "Sliming") and the effects of eating certain [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tins](/wiki/Tin "Tin"), but *not* [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning"). Gaining unchanging while suffering from sliming cures the property. While [riding](/wiki/Riding "Riding"), a worn source of unchanging can protect a [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero")'s steed from [polymorph traps](/wiki/Polymorph_trap "Polymorph trap") while riding.

If a hero dies while they have unchanging and are polymorphed, which would ordinarily return them to normal form, they will instead die as normal in most cases, with the following exceptions:

- While in the form of a [wood](/wiki/Wood_golem "Wood golem") or [leather golem](/wiki/Leather_golem "Leather golem"), the hero is hit by a [brown pudding](/wiki/Brown_pudding "Brown pudding") bite and rots away.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)
- While in the form of an [iron golem](/wiki/Iron_golem "Iron golem"), the hero is hit by a [rust monster](/wiki/Rust_monster "Rust monster") attack and rusts away.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)
- While in the form of a [clay golem](/wiki/Clay_golem "Clay golem"), the hero is hit by the [intrinsic-stealing](/wiki/Intrinsic-stealing "Intrinsic-stealing") attack of a [gremlin](/wiki/Gremlin "Gremlin").[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)
- While in the form of an [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") monster, the hero [prays](/wiki/Pray "Pray") to their [god](/wiki/God "God").

In the listed circumstances, a hero will be returned to normal form even with unchanging.

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Amulet of unchanging](/wiki/Amulet_of_unchanging "Amulet of unchanging")*

Unchanging is typically used to maintain a long-term (and often [controlled](/wiki/Polymorph_control "Polymorph control")) polyself for various purposes, in exchange for the risk of any deaths that occur being permanent when they would not be otherwise. A source of unchanging can also be a good substitute for [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") in areas such as the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines") beyond [Minetown](/wiki/Minetown "Minetown"), where [polymorph traps](/wiki/Polymorph_trap "Polymorph trap") are a major obstacle. Unchanging can also suppress unwanted polymorphing from other sources, such as [lycanthropy](/wiki/Lycanthropy "Lycanthropy").

## Messages

- You can not change from your current form.

  You have unchanging as viewed via [enlightenment](/wiki/Enlightenment "Enlightenment").

## Variants

Some variants implement additional sources of unchanging outside of the amulet of unchanging.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), [deep dragon scales](/wiki/Deep_dragon_scales "Deep dragon scales"), [deep dragon scale mail](/wiki/Deep_dragon_scale_mail "Deep dragon scale mail") and [deep dragon scale shields](/index.php?title=Deep_dragon_scale_shield\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Deep dragon scale shield (page does not exist)") confer unchanging while worn.

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), unchanging is one of the properties that can be conferred by [quaffing](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff") or [dipping](/wiki/Dipping "Dipping") into a [potion of wonder](/wiki/Potion_of_wonder "Potion of wonder").

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), a character with a source of unchanging will not protect their steed from a polymorph trap that they ride over.

A character that dies at the hands of specific monsters (i.e. any [vampire](/wiki/Vampire_\(monster_class\) "Vampire (monster class)"), [mummy](/wiki/Mummy "Mummy"), [wraith](/wiki/Wraith "Wraith"), [ghoul](/wiki/Ghoul "Ghoul"), [zombie](/wiki/Zombie "Zombie"), or [green slime](/wiki/Green_slime "Green slime")) has a varying chance of rising from death and being allowed to continue play as a monster with permanent intrinsic unchanging. A character that starts a game in [polyinit](/index.php?title=Polyinit\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Polyinit (page does not exist)") mode also has permanent intrinsic unchanging.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), the [robe of stasis](/index.php?title=Robe_of_stasis\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Robe of stasis (page does not exist)") is a type of [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak") that confers unchanging while worn.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), a character that dies at the hands of a zombie may rise from the dead and be allowed to continue play with permanent intrinsic unchanging, and characters that die in other circumstances may similarly rise as a [spectre](/wiki/Spectre "Spectre") with permanent intrinsic unchanging.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/mhitu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1458](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mhitu.c#L1458)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/mhitu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1440](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mhitu.c#L1440): *Hit by rusting attack while poly'd*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/mhitu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1537](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mhitu.c#L1537)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Unchanging

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Unchanging is a property in NetHack that prevents the hero from being polymorphed or otherwise transformed into another monster or form.

The only source of the property is the worn amulet of unchanging.

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 Messages
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 dNetHack
    • 4.2 FIQHack
    • 4.3 xNetHack
    • 4.4 SpliceHack
    • 4.5 EvilHack
  • 5 References

Description

Unchanging stops polymorphing and other means of changing form from occurring, including sliming and the effects of eating certain corpses or tins, but not stoning. Gaining unchanging while suffering from sliming cures the property. While riding, a worn source of unchanging can protect a hero's steed from polymorph traps while riding.

If a hero dies while they have unchanging and are polymorphed, which would ordinarily return them to normal form, they will instead die as normal in most cases, with the following exceptions:

  • While in the form of a wood or leather golem, the hero is hit by a brown pudding bite and rots away.[1]
  • While in the form of an iron golem, the hero is hit by a rust monster attack and rusts away.[2]
  • While in the form of a clay golem, the hero is hit by the intrinsic-stealing attack of a gremlin.[3]
  • While in the form of an undead monster, the hero prays to their god.

In the listed circumstances, a hero will be returned to normal form even with unchanging.

Strategy

Main article: Amulet of unchanging

Unchanging is typically used to maintain a long-term (and often controlled) polyself for various purposes, in exchange for the risk of any deaths that occur being permanent when they would not be otherwise. A source of unchanging can also be a good substitute for magic resistance in areas such as the Gnomish Mines beyond Minetown, where polymorph traps are a major obstacle. Unchanging can also suppress unwanted polymorphing from other sources, such as lycanthropy.

Messages

You can not change from your current form.
You have unchanging as viewed via enlightenment.

Variants

Some variants implement additional sources of unchanging outside of the amulet of unchanging.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack, deep dragon scales, deep dragon scale mail and deep dragon scale shields confer unchanging while worn.

FIQHack

In FIQHack, unchanging is one of the properties that can be conferred by quaffing or dipping into a potion of wonder.

xNetHack

In xNetHack, a character with a source of unchanging will not protect their steed from a polymorph trap that they ride over.

A character that dies at the hands of specific monsters (i.e. any vampire, mummy, wraith, ghoul, zombie, or green slime) has a varying chance of rising from death and being allowed to continue play as a monster with permanent intrinsic unchanging. A character that starts a game in polyinit mode also has permanent intrinsic unchanging.

SpliceHack

In SpliceHack, the robe of stasis is a type of cloak that confers unchanging while worn.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, a character that dies at the hands of a zombie may rise from the dead and be allowed to continue play with permanent intrinsic unchanging, and characters that die in other circumstances may similarly rise as a spectre with permanent intrinsic unchanging.

References

  1. ↑ src/mhitu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1458
  2. ↑ src/mhitu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1440: Hit by rusting attack while poly'd
  3. ↑ src/mhitu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1537

rawPage:
'''Unchanging''' is a [[property]] in ''[[NetHack]]'' that prevents the [[hero]] from being [[polymorph]]ed or otherwise transformed into another [[monster]] or form.

The only source of the property is the [[worn]] [[amulet of unchanging]].

==Description==
Unchanging stops polymorphing and other means of changing form from occurring, including [[sliming]] and the effects of eating certain [[corpse]]s or [[tin]]s, but ''not'' [[stoning]]. Gaining unchanging while suffering from sliming cures the property. While [[riding]], a worn source of unchanging can protect a [[hero]]'s steed from [[polymorph trap]]s while riding.

If a hero dies while they have unchanging and are polymorphed, which would ordinarily return them to normal form, they will instead die as normal in most cases, with the following exceptions:

* While in the form of a [[wood golem|wood]] or [[leather golem]], the hero is hit by a [[brown pudding]] bite and rots away.{{refsrc|src/mhitu.c|1458|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}
* While in the form of an [[iron golem]], the hero is hit by a [[rust monster]] attack and rusts away.{{refsrc|src/mhitu.c|1440|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=Hit by rusting attack while poly'd}}
* While in the form of a [[clay golem]], the hero is hit by the [[intrinsic-stealing]] attack of a [[gremlin]].{{refsrc|src/mhitu.c|1537|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}
* While in the form of an [[undead]] monster, the hero [[pray]]s to their [[god]].

In the listed circumstances, a hero will be returned to normal form even with unchanging.

==Strategy==
{{main|Amulet of unchanging}}
Unchanging is typically used to maintain a long-term (and often [[Polymorph control|controlled]]) polyself for various purposes, in exchange for the risk of any deaths that occur being permanent when they would not be otherwise. A source of unchanging can also be a good substitute for [[magic resistance]] in areas such as the [[Gnomish Mines]] beyond [[Minetown]], where [[polymorph trap]]s are a major obstacle. Unchanging can also suppress unwanted polymorphing from other sources, such as [[lycanthropy]].

==Messages==
{{message|You can not change from your current form.|You have unchanging as viewed via [[enlightenment]].}}

==Variants==
Some variants implement additional sources of unchanging outside of the amulet of unchanging.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]], [[deep dragon scales]], [[deep dragon scale mail]] and [[deep dragon scale shield]]s confer unchanging while worn.

===FIQHack===
In [[FIQHack]], unchanging is one of the properties that can be conferred by [[quaff]]ing or [[dipping]] into a [[potion of wonder]].

===xNetHack===
In [[xNetHack]], a character with a source of unchanging will not protect their steed from a polymorph trap that they ride over.

A character that dies at the hands of specific monsters (i.e. any [[Vampire (monster class)|vampire]], [[mummy]], [[wraith]], [[ghoul]], [[zombie]], or [[green slime]]) has a varying chance of rising from death and being allowed to continue play as a monster with permanent intrinsic unchanging. A character that starts a game in [[polyinit]] mode also has permanent intrinsic unchanging.

===SpliceHack===
In [[SpliceHack]], the [[robe of stasis]] is a type of [[cloak]] that confers unchanging while worn.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], a character that dies at the hands of a zombie may rise from the dead and be allowed to continue play with permanent intrinsic unchanging, and characters that die in other circumstances may similarly rise as a [[spectre]] with permanent intrinsic unchanging.

==References==
